text: Erigeron fukuyamae is an Asian species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It has been found only in alpine meadows at high elevations in Taiwan in East Asia. Erigeron fukuyamae is a perennial, clump-forming herb up to 30 cm (12 inches) tall, forming short rhizomes and a branching underground caudex. Its flower heads have red ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron fukuyamae Kitamura, 1933. 台湾飞蓬 tai wan fei peng ==References== fukuyamae Category:Endemic flora of Taiwan Category:Plants described in 1933
title: Erigeron fukuyamae
